intro: Asterocephalus capillatus, commonly known as the slender-headed asterocephalus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves, and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a Mediterranean climate with mild, wet winters and dry summers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
